prediction:
Cryptorchidism, also known as undescended testicle, is a condition where one or both testicles fail to descend into the scrotum. The treatment for cryptorchidism typically depends on the age of the individual and the position of the testicle. In cases where the testicle is located in the iliac fossa, surgical intervention is usually recommended. This procedure is important as leaving the testicle in this area can bring various complications, including torsion.

Having a single testicle may not typically cause problems with fatherhood, as the remaining testicle is usually able to produce enough sperm for fertility. However, it is important to consult with a healthcare provider for further evaluation and management of cryptorchidism.
